title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.24-25 | 20-11-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Meelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunya Vadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Srivasa Adi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chaiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasaam Tatho Jaya Mudeerayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 24th and the 25th verses of the 6th chapter
of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
First the 24th verse Matir Mayi Nibaddheyam
Na Vipadyeta Karihichit Praja Sarga Nirodhepi
Smritischa Mad Anugrahat
The meaning of this verse is
Intelligence engaged in my devotion cannot be thwarted at any time
Even at the time of creation as well as at the time of annihilation
Your remembrance will continue by my mercy
The Supreme Lord is speaking to Narada
He is unseen but he is heard
After Narada had a brief glimpse of the Lord in the heart
And he tried to get that darshan once again but he could not
And the Lord spoke to him to pacify Narada
So in this verse
The Lord is speaking to Narada
He is explaining something very important
Intelligence engaged in my devotion cannot be thwarted at any time
So everything in relationship with the Lord is eternal
Nothing is temporary
There is no question of any loss in devotional service
So Shri Lakshmi...
Sri La Prabhupada explains in the purport devotional service rendered to the
personality of Godhead never goes in vain since the personality of Godhead is
eternal intelligence supplied in his service or anything done in his relation
is also permanent we have experienced materially whatever we may do it is not
going to last forever it is subject to annihilation by time
everything material is like that in fact the whole creation itself is completely
annihilated at the end of Rama's life so everything material is subject to
destruction by time everything spiritual is permanent
eternal never subject to any loss or deterioration by time this is very
important principle we have to remember we have to understand and we have to
apply so how should we be spending our time we should be very careful to spend
our time exclusively in devotional activities and devotional service
in the Bhagavad Gita it is said that such transcendental service rendered unto
the personality of Godhead accumulates birth after birth see it's not lost we
may make some progress by doing devotional service in this life even if
we don't complete there is no loss Arjuna asked
this question in the sixth chapter of the Bhagavad Gita Arjuna asked what
happens if somebody takes to devotional service but does not complete isn't he a
loser both spiritually and materially because for taking up devotional service
one sacrifices material enjoyment material engagements so he loses
materially as well as spiritually because spiritually he is not successful
so does it mean whatever devotional activity says performed is completely a
wasted a waste of time no Krishna says no anything done in devotional service
bears permanent result bears permanent result it's never lost and one continues
end devotional advancement in the next life from where he left off in his
previous life this is very important supposing you have earned a lot of
wealth do you carry any credit for that wealth earned in this life if you are
unable to exhaust that wealth or spend it off you have a huge bank balance so
when you quit the body what happens to that bank balance it doesn't go with you
you don't get any credit in your next life here to begin again so unlike
material gain in this life which is never
carried forward to the next life or to the future spiritual advancement is
always eternally carried forward it is never lost so therefore when the
devotee is fully matured the total service counted together makes him
eligible to enter into the association of the personality of Godhead so even if
we make some progress that progress is permanently to the credit of the
devotee devotional service is associated with the soul not with the body so body
is replaced body is changed but the soul is eternal the person as spirit soul is
eternal his devotional credit
is
eternal his devotional credit is
eternal his devotional credit is
also eternal such accumulation of God's service is never vanquished but increases
till fully matured verse number 25 etavad uktopara rama tanmahad bhutam
nabholingam alingam ishwaram aham chatasmai mahatam mahiyase hirsnavanamam vidadhe anukampitaham
the meaning of this verse is then that supreme authority personified by sound
and unseen by eyes but most wonderful stopped speaking feeling a sense of
gratitude I offered my obeisances unto him bowing my head so Narada has heard
the Supreme Lord speak and and in his own words he is describing it was a
most wonderful speech that he heard and he is describing here that it was a
supreme authority the Supreme Lord is a supreme authority personified by sound
he could clearly hear the Lord speaking but he could not see the Lord unseen by
eyes
so Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport that the personality of Godhead
was not seen but only heard does not make any difference in spiritual life we
learn about the absolute nature of the Supreme Lord the personality of Godhead
what is the meaning of absolute nature
the Lord the person personality of the Lord his name his form his qualities his
speech his instructions his abode his paraphernalia everything is identical
with him 100% that means the Lord is fully present in his name if I say
Krishna
in these two syllables the Lord is fully present as transcendental sound we are
able to hear that sound Hare Krishna or Krishna the name Krishna but in that
sound he is fully present unlike a material sound where we say this is a
table the sound table reference the the company of prереquited in the kristini end and also the school of Godhead and
refers to another object called the table
The sound table and object table are two distinct different entities
We make the association by saying this is called a table
That is not the case with the Lord's name or
the Lord's instructions or the Lord's form or the Lord's
qualities or his activities
descriptions of his
features all are identical with him
So it is explained here by Srila Prabhupada further the personality of Godhead produced the four Vedas by his breathing
This is what the Vedas say. How did he
Give the Vedas in the beginning of the book
of the creation
He produced the Vedas the four Vedas the original Vedic knowledge by his breathing
And
He is seen and realized through the transcendental sound of the Vedas
The Vedas are again non-different from him
because
Vedas are
describing the absolute personality of Godhead
Therefore he is seen and realized
Through the transcendental sound of the Vedas
Formerly there was no need of any
Written books
simply
the teacher
would
Recite the Vedas the student would hear
the recitation by the master by the teacher and
simply

By hearing the edict of the master by the teacher by hearing the student's studying of the Vedas etc, etc etc, etc etc, etc, etc. This incident be a study of阿 aquí remedy especially in School by the Master by the teacher by the Teacher simply by hearing the student to learn the recitation by the Master by the teacherer fully as the teacher did not hear the recitation from the various references짱
with full attention the student would realize the subject matter completely
so this is the method even Srimad Bhagavatam recommends that you simply
hear the Bhagavatam and you can realize Krishna because Bhagavatam is non
different from Krishna Bhagavatam is the incarnation the literary incarnation of
the Supreme Personality of Godhead Krishna so simply by hearing Bhagavatam
you can realize Krishna and that's how Parikshit Maharaj realized that's how
Shukadeva Goswami realized he simply heard the Bhagavatam from his father
Vyasadeva Vyasadeva heard from Narada the Bhagavatam and realized the subject
matter
realized subject matter of Krishna Vyasadeva heard from Narada Narada heard
from Brahma Brahma heard from Krishna himself so it is explained here the
Bhagavad Gita is the sound representation of the Lord and there is
no difference in identity Bhagavad Gita is personally spoken by
Krishna to Arjuna and through Arjuna to all of us
to everyone
everyone in the whole world so when Krishna spoke whatever words came out of
Krishna's lotus mouth that is identical with Krishna himself so even today we
can hear the Bhagavad Gita we can recite the Bhagavad Gita we can study the
Bhagavad Gita we can understand the message of the Gita when it is explained
by a spiritual master bona fide spiritual master in parampara in this way
a Bhagavad Gita is non different from Krishna so the conclusion is that the
Lord can be seen and heard by person chanting of the transcendental sound the
transcendental sound of the Bhagavad Gita when Krishna spoke the lotus mouth
sound could be the sound of Bhagavatam the sound of the Hare Krishna mantra the
sound of Krishna's instructions anything so transcendental sound we simply have
to chant and in this way by hearing repeatedly persistently with full
attention offenselessly we can fully realize Krishna I'll stop here thank you
very much Hare Krishna
